byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma reported from Kathmandu, and Nida Najar from New Delhi.
byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Nepal formally adopts constitution and Pres Ram Baran Yadav hails achievement after signing document; political infighting has delayed adoption of constitution for almost decade, and process that led to current document was attended by violence that left more than 40 dead.
lead_paragraph: After nearly a decade of delay, the Himalayan nation formally adopted a constitution, though some object to provincial boundaries.
snippet: After nearly a decade of delay, the Himalayan nation formally adopted a constitution, though some object to provincial boundaries.
